data.title: Sudoku Solver
data.solution:
line_1 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_2 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_3 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_4 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_5 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_6 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_7 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_8 = [int(x) for x in input()]
line_9 = [int(x) for x in input()]
input = [line_1, line_2, line_3, line_4, line_5, line_6, line_7, line_8, line_9]
def findNextCellToFill(puzzle, i, j):
        for x in range(i,9):
                for y in range(j,9):
                        if puzzle[x][y] == 0:
                                return x,y
        for x in range(0,9):
                for y in range(0,9):
                        if puzzle[x][y] == 0:
                                return x,y
        return -1,-1
def isValid(puzzle, i, j, num):
        rowValid = all([num != puzzle[i][x] for x in range(9)])
        if rowValid:
                columnValid = all([num != puzzle[x][j] for x in range(9)])
                if columnValid:
                        secTopX, secTopY = 3 *(i//3), 3 *(j//3) 
                        for x in range(secTopX, secTopX+3):
                                for y in range(secTopY, secTopY+3):
                                        if puzzle[x][y] == num:
                                                return False
                        return True
        return False
def solveSudoku(puzzle, i=0, j=0):
        i, j = findNextCellToFill(puzzle, i, j)
        if i == -1:
                return True
        for num in range(1,10):
                if isValid(puzzle, i, j, num):
                        puzzle[i][j] = num
                        if solveSudoku(puzzle, i, j):
                                return True
                        puzzle[i][j] = 0
solveSudoku(input)
input[0] = [str(i) for i in input[0]]
input[1] = [str(i) for i in input[1]]
input[2] = [str(i) for i in input[2]]
input[3] = [str(i) for i in input[3]]
input[4] = [str(i) for i in input[4]]
input[5] = [str(i) for i in input[5]]
input[6] = [str(i) for i in input[6]]
input[7] = [str(i) for i in input[7]]
input[8] = [str(i) for i in input[8]]
print(''.join(input[0]))
print(''.join(input[1]))
print(''.join(input[2]))
print(''.join(input[3]))
print(''.join(input[4]))
print(''.join(input[5]))
print(''.join(input[6]))
print(''.join(input[7]))
print(''.join(input[8]))
data.statement: Your program must output a solution to a 9x9 sudoku.  A sudoku is a Latin Square which has the numbers 1-9 in each row, column, and 3x3 square.
data.inputDescription: First 9 lines: A string [[line]] with 9 digits corresponding to that line.  A 0 is used for an empty space.
data.outputDescription: First 9 lines: A string [[line]] with 9 digits corresponding to that line.  The original numbers should not have changed, and there should be no zeros left.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Your program must output a solution to a 9x9 sudoku. A sudoku is a Latin Square which has the numbers 1-9 in each row, column, and 3x3 square.
Input
First 9 lines: A string line with 9 digits corresponding to that line. A 0 is used for an empty space.
Output
First 9 lines: A string line with 9 digits corresponding to that line. The original numbers should not have changed, and there should be no zeros left.
Constraints
Example
Input
120070560
507932080
000001000
010240050
308000402
070085010
000700000
080423701
034010028
Output
123874569
567932184
849651237
916247853
358196472
472385916
291768345
685423791
734519628
